00007 // Parsed command representation
00008 #define EXEC  1
00009 #define REDIR 2
00010 #define PIPE  3
00011 #define LIST  4
00012 #define BACK  5
00013 
00014 #define MAXARGS 10

00018 };

00052 int fork1(void);  // Fork but panics on failure.
00053 void panic(char*);

00055 
00056 // Execute cmd.  Never returns.
00057 void
00058 runcmd(struct cmd *cmd)
00059 {
00060   int p[2];
00061   struct backcmd *bcmd;
00062   struct execcmd *ecmd;
00063   struct listcmd *lcmd;
00064   struct pipecmd *pcmd;
00065   struct redircmd *rcmd;
00066 
00067   if(cmd == 0)
00068     exit();
00069   
00070   switch(cmd->type){
00071   default:
00072     panic("runcmd");
00073 
00074   case EXEC:
00075     ecmd = (struct execcmd*)cmd;
00076     if(ecmd->argv[0] == 0)
00077       exit();
00078     exec(ecmd->argv[0], ecmd->argv);
00079     printf(2, "exec %s failed\n", ecmd->argv[0]);
00080     break;
00081 
00082   case REDIR:
00083     rcmd = (struct redircmd*)cmd;
00084     close(rcmd->fd);
00085     if(open(rcmd->file, rcmd->mode) < 0){
00086       printf(2, "open %s failed\n", rcmd->file);
00087       exit();
00088     }
00089     runcmd(rcmd->cmd);
00090     break;
00091 
00092   case LIST:
00093     lcmd = (struct listcmd*)cmd;
00094     if(fork1() == 0)
00095       runcmd(lcmd->left);
00096     wait();
00097     runcmd(lcmd->right);
00098     break;
00099 
00100   case PIPE:
00101     pcmd = (struct pipecmd*)cmd;
00102     if(pipe(p) < 0)
00103       panic("pipe");
00104     if(fork1() == 0){
00105       close(1);
00106       dup(p[1]);
00107       close(p[0]);
00108       close(p[1]);
00109       runcmd(pcmd->left);
00110     }
00111     if(fork1() == 0){
00112       close(0);
00113       dup(p[0]);
00114       close(p[0]);
00115       close(p[1]);
00116       runcmd(pcmd->right);
00117     }
00118     close(p[0]);
00119     close(p[1]);
00120     wait();
00121     wait();
00122     break;
00123     
00124   case BACK:
00125     bcmd = (struct backcmd*)cmd;
00126     if(fork1() == 0)
00127       runcmd(bcmd->cmd);
00128     break;
00129   }
00130   exit();
00131 }
00132 
00133 int
00134 getcmd(char *buf, int nbuf)
00135 {
00136   printf(2, "$ ");
00137   memset(buf, 0, nbuf);
00138   gets(buf, nbuf);
00139   if(buf[0] == 0) // EOF
00140     return -1;
00141   return 0;
00142 }
00143 
00144 int
00145 main(void)
00146 {
00147   static char buf[100];
00148   int fd;
00149   
00150   // Assumes three file descriptors open.
00151   while((fd = open("console", O_RDWR)) >= 0){
00152     if(fd >= 3){
00153       close(fd);
00154       break;
00155     }
00156   }
00157   
00158   // Read and run input commands.
00159   while(getcmd(buf, sizeof(buf)) >= 0){
00160     if(buf[0] == 'c' && buf[1] == 'd' && buf[2] == ' '){
00161       // Clumsy but will have to do for now.
00162       // Chdir has no effect on the parent if run in the child.
00163       buf[strlen(buf)-1] = 0;  // chop \n
00164       if(chdir(buf+3) < 0)
00165         printf(2, "cannot cd %s\n", buf+3);
00166       continue;
00167     }
00168     if(fork1() == 0)
00169       runcmd(parsecmd(buf));
00170     wait();
00171   }
00172   exit();
00173 }

00175 void
00176 panic(char *s)
00177 {
00178   printf(2, "%s\n", s);
00179   exit();
00180 }

00182 int
00183 fork1(void)
00184 {
00185   int pid;
00186   
00187   pid = fork();
00188   if(pid == -1)
00189     panic("fork");
00190   return pid;
00191 }

00196 struct cmd*
00197 execcmd(void)
00198 {
00199   struct execcmd *cmd;
00200 
00201   cmd = malloc(sizeof(*cmd));
00202   memset(cmd, 0, sizeof(*cmd));
00203   cmd->type = EXEC;
00204   return (struct cmd*)cmd;
00205 }

00207 struct cmd*
00208 redircmd(struct cmd *subcmd, char *file, char *efile, int mode, int fd)
00209 {
00210   struct redircmd *cmd;
00211 
00212   cmd = malloc(sizeof(*cmd));
00213   memset(cmd, 0, sizeof(*cmd));
00214   cmd->type = REDIR;
00215   cmd->cmd = subcmd;
00216   cmd->file = file;
00217   cmd->efile = efile;
00218   cmd->mode = mode;
00219   cmd->fd = fd;
00220   return (struct cmd*)cmd;
00221 }

00260 //PAGEBREAK!
00261 // Parsing
00262 
00263 char whitespace[] = " \t\r\n\v";
00264 char symbols[] = "<|>&;()";
00265 
00266 int
00267 gettoken(char **ps, char *es, char **q, char **eq)
00268 {
00269   char *s;
00270   int ret;
00271   
00272   s = *ps;
00273   while(s < es && strchr(whitespace, *s))
00274     s++;
00275   if(q)
00276     *q = s;
00277   ret = *s;
00278   switch(*s){
00279   case 0:
00280     break;
00281   case '|':
00282   case '(':
00283   case ')':
00284   case ';':
00285   case '&':
00286   case '<':
00287     s++;
00288     break;
00289   case '>':
00290     s++;
00291     if(*s == '>'){
00292       ret = '+';
00293       s++;
00294     }
00295     break;
00296   default:
00297     ret = 'a';
00298     while(s < es && !strchr(whitespace, *s) && !strchr(symbols, *s))
00299       s++;
00300     break;
00301   }
00302   if(eq)
00303     *eq = s;
00304   
00305   while(s < es && strchr(whitespace, *s))
00306     s++;
00307   *ps = s;
00308   return ret;
00309 }
00310 
00311 int
00312 peek(char **ps, char *es, char *toks)
00313 {
00314   char *s;
00315   
00316   s = *ps;
00317   while(s < es && strchr(whitespace, *s))
00318     s++;
00319   *ps = s;
00320   return *s && strchr(toks, *s);
00321 }

00323 struct cmd *parseline(char**, char*);
00324 struct cmd *parsepipe(char**, char*);
00325 struct cmd *parseexec(char**, char*);
00326 struct cmd *nulterminate(struct cmd*);
00327 
00328 struct cmd*
00329 parsecmd(char *s)
00330 {
00331   char *es;
00332   struct cmd *cmd;
00333 
00334   es = s + strlen(s);
00335   cmd = parseline(&s, es);
00336   peek(&s, es, "");
00337   if(s != es){
00338     printf(2, "leftovers: %s\n", s);
00339     panic("syntax");
00340   }
00341   nulterminate(cmd);
00342   return cmd;
00343 }
00344 
00345 struct cmd*
00346 parseline(char **ps, char *es)
00347 {
00348   struct cmd *cmd;
00349 
00350   cmd = parsepipe(ps, es);
00351   while(peek(ps, es, "&")){
00352     gettoken(ps, es, 0, 0);
00353     cmd = backcmd(cmd);
00354   }
00355   if(peek(ps, es, ";")){
00356     gettoken(ps, es, 0, 0);
00357     cmd = listcmd(cmd, parseline(ps, es));
00358   }
00359   return cmd;
00360 }
00361 
00362 struct cmd*
00363 parsepipe(char **ps, char *es)
00364 {
00365   struct cmd *cmd;
00366 
00367   cmd = parseexec(ps, es);
00368   if(peek(ps, es, "|")){
00369     gettoken(ps, es, 0, 0);
00370     cmd = pipecmd(cmd, parsepipe(ps, es));
00371   }
00372   return cmd;
00373 }
00374 
00375 struct cmd*
00376 parseredirs(struct cmd *cmd, char **ps, char *es)
00377 {
00378   int tok;
00379   char *q, *eq;
00380 
00381   while(peek(ps, es, "<>")){
00382     tok = gettoken(ps, es, 0, 0);
00383     if(gettoken(ps, es, &q, &eq) != 'a')
00384       panic("missing file for redirection");
00385     switch(tok){
00386     case '<':
00387       cmd = redircmd(cmd, q, eq, O_RDONLY, 0);
00388       break;
00389     case '>':
00390       cmd = redircmd(cmd, q, eq, O_WRONLY|O_CREATE, 1);
00391       break;
00392     case '+':  // >>
00393       cmd = redircmd(cmd, q, eq, O_WRONLY|O_CREATE, 1);
00394       break;
00395     }
00396   }
00397   return cmd;
00398 }
00399 
00400 struct cmd*
00401 parseblock(char **ps, char *es)
00402 {
00403   struct cmd *cmd;
00404 
00405   if(!peek(ps, es, "("))
00406     panic("parseblock");
00407   gettoken(ps, es, 0, 0);
00408   cmd = parseline(ps, es);
00409   if(!peek(ps, es, ")"))
00410     panic("syntax - missing )");
00411   gettoken(ps, es, 0, 0);
00412   cmd = parseredirs(cmd, ps, es);
00413   return cmd;
00414 }
00415 
00416 struct cmd*
00417 parseexec(char **ps, char *es)
00418 {
00419   char *q, *eq;
00420   int tok, argc;
00421   struct execcmd *cmd;
00422   struct cmd *ret;
00423   
00424   if(peek(ps, es, "("))
00425     return parseblock(ps, es);
00426 
00427   ret = execcmd();
00428   cmd = (struct execcmd*)ret;
00429 
00430   argc = 0;
00431   ret = parseredirs(ret, ps, es);
00432   while(!peek(ps, es, "|)&;")){
00433     if((tok=gettoken(ps, es, &q, &eq)) == 0)
00434       break;
00435     if(tok != 'a')
00436       panic("syntax");
00437     cmd->argv[argc] = q;
00438     cmd->eargv[argc] = eq;
00439     argc++;
00440     if(argc >= MAXARGS)
00441       panic("too many args");
00442     ret = parseredirs(ret, ps, es);
00443   }
00444   cmd->argv[argc] = 0;
00445   cmd->eargv[argc] = 0;
00446   return ret;
00447 }
00448 
00449 // NUL-terminate all the counted strings.
00450 struct cmd*
00451 nulterminate(struct cmd *cmd)
00452 {
00453   int i;
00454   struct backcmd *bcmd;
00455   struct execcmd *ecmd;
00456   struct listcmd *lcmd;
00457   struct pipecmd *pcmd;
00458   struct redircmd *rcmd;
00459 
00460   if(cmd == 0)
00461     return 0;
00462   
00463   switch(cmd->type){
00464   case EXEC:
00465     ecmd = (struct execcmd*)cmd;
00466     for(i=0; ecmd->argv[i]; i++)
00467       *ecmd->eargv[i] = 0;
00468     break;
00469 
00470   case REDIR:
00471     rcmd = (struct redircmd*)cmd;
00472     nulterminate(rcmd->cmd);
00473     *rcmd->efile = 0;
00474     break;
00475 
00476   case PIPE:
00477     pcmd = (struct pipecmd*)cmd;
00478     nulterminate(pcmd->left);
00479     nulterminate(pcmd->right);
00480     break;
00481     
00482   case LIST:
00483     lcmd = (struct listcmd*)cmd;
00484     nulterminate(lcmd->left);
00485     nulterminate(lcmd->right);
00486     break;
00487 
00488   case BACK:
00489     bcmd = (struct backcmd*)cmd;
00490     nulterminate(bcmd->cmd);
00491     break;
00492   }
00493   return cmd;
00494 }
